Name: 17_ice_march_europe_warming
Representative_Docs: Copernicus Warmest March in Europe, lowest Arctic winter sea ice March 2025 was the second warmest March globally, with an average ERA5 surface air temperature of 14.06°C, 0.65°C above the 1991-2020 average and 1.60°C above the pre-industrial level for March. climate.copernicus.eucopernicus-w...

Europe has just had its hottest March on record. The record is is part of a trend of extraordinary global heat. It was also the second-warmest March globally, behind March 2024. On average, global temperatures in March were 1.6C higher than pre-industrial levels.

Last year was the hottest year on record for Europe, with record-high annual temperatures in almost half of the continent. The latest European State of the Climate report from the EU’s Copernicus service C3S shows that 45% of days were much warmer than average, and 12% were the warmest on record
